# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/platformdirs/__main__.py
@source-hash: 8c127ccdbecca71e
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:47Z

## Purpose
Main entry point module for the platformdirs package, providing a command-line demonstration of platform-specific directory discovery functionality.

## Key Components

### Constants
- `PROPS` (L7-23): Tuple containing 14 standardized directory property names for both user and site directories, including data, config, cache, state, log, documents, downloads, pictures, videos, music, and runtime directories.

### Functions
- `main()` (L26-51): Primary demonstration function that showcases PlatformDirs usage across four different initialization scenarios:
  1. With app name, author, and version (L34-36)
  2. With app name and author only (L39-41) 
  3. With app name only (L44-46)
  4. With app name and disabled appauthor (L49-51)

## Dependencies
- `PlatformDirs`: Core class imported from pip._vendor.platformdirs for directory path resolution
- `__version__`: Version string for display purposes

## Architecture Pattern
Follows a simple demonstration pattern using hardcoded test values ("MyApp", "MyCompany", "1.0") to illustrate different PlatformDirs constructor configurations. Uses dynamic attribute access via `getattr()` to iterate through all directory properties.

## Key Behavior
The module systematically demonstrates how different initialization parameters affect directory path resolution across all supported directory types, printing formatted output for each scenario to showcase cross-platform directory standards compliance.
